3 Nov. 1868.
HC: is the date correct? See 68.09.00 where M thanks Joseph for coming to Wilhlem's aid - W is already back in Dresden. See also 68.11.03 where the amount listed for publication for 1868 was £150 so that M cannot be suggesting a reduction in this vote for 1869 of £200.

In compliance with your instructions I have the honor in pointing out, what reductions might most advantageously be effected in the expenditure of the botanical Garden and the institutions connected therewith during the coming year, as contrasted with the outlay incurred in former years.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
1, Abolishment of the Office of Assistant
Carl Wilhelmi.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
£350
MS marginal annotation by Grant, 28 November 1868: 'Appd'.

div.p: This saving for economys sake may well be effected without any injury of the work of the department, in as much as the work hitherto performed by the assistant can be carried out through redistribution of labor by one of the junior employees. In recommending therefore, that the services of the officer alluded to be dispensed with at the end of the year, simply to save the expenditure involved, I beg to solicit, that the full recompensation may be given him, to which under the XVI clause of the Civil Servants Act he becomes entitled. I would further beg leave most respectfully to ask, that in the appointments anew arising by the extension of the Railways or the waterworks or any other Departments you and your honorable Colleagues may be pleased to take the length of time, during which the Assistant was connected with the botanical establishment into most favorable consideration.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p: 2, Savings by a slight reduction of the wages and by diminishing to a small extent the number of the employées

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p: By these means all the branches of the active services may be maintained in unimpaired efficiency.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p: 3, Reduction of the vote for publishing works on plants by

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p: This reduction will not longer admit of the issue of lithographies, but otherwise the publications can be continued.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p: 4, Still farther economizing the forage vote for the carthorses, aviary birds, waterbirds &c

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p: 5, Decrease of the vote for stores, building material, fuel, drainpipes, flowerpots &c

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p: This vote cannot possibly be farther reduced as fuel will be required for the constant or frequent working of the engine to raise Yarra water under complete exclusion of the Yan Yean water.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p: The total reductions would thus amount to

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p: for 1869. The gradual completion of the drive and other heavy work will admit of still farther reductions in 1870.
